title: Jurgen Klopp expects Tottenham to use Champions League final disappointment as fuel against Liverpool
text:
Four months on from the Champions League final, it’s hard not to think of the sliding doors effect it has bestowed upon Liverpool and Tottenham.

Liverpool’s 2-0 success in Madrid was not a classic performance, but the outcome was all that mattered. They are European champions and have carried that belief and momentum into their unbeaten start to the Premier League as they sit top after nine games.

For Spurs, since that June evening, there have only been recriminations and regret at what might have been. Players and manager Mauricio Pochettino must wonder if that chance to reach the summit will ever come their way again.

To illustrate the way their paths have diverged, the Champions League finalists are already separated by 13 points in the league.

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp, who has only watched a rerun of the final twice, recognises a maturity gleaned from the experience of losing the 2018 final to Real Madrid that has stood them in good stead.
description: Four months on from the Champions League final, it’s hard not to think of the sliding doors effect it has bestowed upon Liverpool and Tottenham.
